entry.et: Middle English thret coercion, threat, from Old English thrēat coercion; akin to Middle High German drōz annoyance, Latin trudere to push, thrust

def.dt: :an expression of intention to inflict evil, injury, or damage
:an indication of something impending the sky held a threat of rain
:a football player adept at running, kicking, and passing
:a person adept in three different fields of activity
